_comment: Configuration with rules enabled by default. Severity levels are defined by rule developers - users don't configure severity.

kwargs._comment: Optional: Specify a custom pylintrc file path. If not specified, uses .config/.ignition-pylintrc
kwargs._debug_comment: Optional: Set debug: true to save script files even when there are no errors. Debug files are ALWAYS saved automatically when pylint finds errors, and are cleaned up at the start of each run.
kwargs._debug_dir_comment: Optional: Specify custom debug directory. Defaults to .ignition-lint/debug/ (or tests/debug/ in ignition-lint repo). Can be absolute or relative path.
kwargs._batch_mode_comment: Optional: Set batch_mode: true to process all files together (faster but harder to review). Default: false (process files individually for clearer per-file reporting).
kwargs._category_mapping_comment: Optional: Map pylint message categories to severity levels. Default: F/E → error, W/C/R → warning. Categories: F=Fatal, E=Error, W=Warning, C=Convention, R=Refactor.

kwargs._comment: Use 'convention' for predefined patterns, or 'pattern' with 'suggestion_convention' for custom regex patterns. 'pattern' takes priority over 'convention'.

component._severity_comment: Components: Use 'error' for strict enforcement of naming standards

property._severity_comment: Properties: Use 'warning' for more lenient custom property naming

message_handler._severity_comment: Message handlers: Use 'warning' to allow flexibility in message naming

custom_method._severity_comment: Custom methods: Use 'error' for consistent Python-style method naming

kwargs._pattern_example_comment: Example using custom pattern with suggestion_convention:

_example._note: When using 'pattern', add 'suggestion_convention' to provide helpful naming suggestions and 'pattern_description' for clearer error messages

kwargs._comment: Detects excessive context data in custom properties using 4 methods: (1) max_array_size: arrays with too many items, (2) max_sibling_properties: too many properties at the same level, (3) max_nesting_depth: overly deep nesting, (4) max_data_points: total volume of data stored in custom properties.

Detects brittle component references like .getSibling(), .getParent(), .getChild(), .parent, .children that create tight coupling to view structure. Use view.custom properties or message handling instead.
kwargs._severity_comment: Optional: Set to 'warning' if you want to detect these patterns without blocking builds. Use 'error' (default) for strict enforcement to prevent brittle view structure dependencies.

kwargs._comment: Validates that component references (expressions, property bindings, scripts) resolve to components that actually exist in the view hierarchy. Prevents runtime errors from broken references.
kwargs._validation_comment: Set individual validation flags to false to disable checking specific reference types (expressions: {../Component.props.value}, property bindings: ../Component.props.enabled, scripts: self.getSibling('Component'))

_info._description: Rule severity levels are defined by rule developers:

rule_severities.NamePatternRule: configurable per node type - naming conventions can be strict (error) or lenient (warning) based on component type
rule_severities.PollingIntervalRule: error - performance issues that can cause system problems
rule_severities.PylintScriptRule: error - syntax errors, undefined variables, etc.
rule_severities.UnusedCustomPropertiesRule: error - dead code that should be removed
rule_severities.ExcessiveContextDataRule: error - architectural issue, data should be in databases
rule_severities.BadComponentReferenceRule: error (configurable) - brittle view structure dependencies that break during refactoring
rule_severities.ComponentReferenceValidationRule: error - references to non-existent components cause runtime errors

_info.note: Most rule severity levels are fixed, but NamePatternRule and BadComponentReferenceRule allow user configuration.

PylintScriptRule_config.pylintrc: Path to custom pylintrc file. Defaults to .config/ignition.pylintrc if not specified.
PylintScriptRule_config.category_mapping: Maps pylint message categories (F/E/W/C/R) to ignition-lint severity levels (error/warning). Violations are grouped by category in output.
PylintScriptRule_config.example_strict: To treat all violations as errors: {"F": "error", "E": "error", "W": "error", "C": "error", "R": "error"}
PylintScriptRule_config.debug_dir: Directory for pylint debug files. Defaults to .ignition-lint/debug/ in user repos, tests/debug/ in ignition-lint repo. Files are cleaned up at start of each run.
PylintScriptRule_config.debug: When true, always saves debug files. When false, only saves when violations found. Debug files help troubleshoot pylint issues.

NamePatternRule_config.severity: Configurable per node type: 'error' or 'warning'. Each node type (component, property, message_handler, custom_method) can have its own severity level.

severity_use_cases.component_error: Recommended - Strictly enforce component naming standards (PascalCase) as these are visible throughout the application
severity_use_cases.property_warning: Recommended - Allow flexibility in custom property naming while still providing guidance
severity_use_cases.message_handler_warning: Recommended - Allow flexibility in message type naming to accommodate team conventions
severity_use_cases.custom_method_error: Recommended - Enforce Python-style method naming (snake_case) for consistency with Ignition scripting

NamePatternRule_config.configuration_example: Set severity per node type in node_type_specific_rules: {"component": {"convention": "PascalCase", "severity": "error"}, "property": {"convention": "camelCase", "severity": "warning"}}
NamePatternRule_config.granularity: Per-node-type severity allows fine-grained control - enforce strict standards where it matters (components, methods) while allowing flexibility elsewhere (properties, message handlers)
NamePatternRule_config.migration_strategy: Start with all 'warning' to identify issues, then gradually move critical node types (components, custom_methods) to 'error' for enforcement

severity_use_cases.error: Recommended for most projects - strictly enforces best practices to prevent brittle view structure dependencies that break during refactoring
severity_use_cases.warning: Use when migrating legacy views or during gradual adoption - allows you to detect these patterns without blocking builds/commits

BadComponentReferenceRule_config.forbidden_patterns: Optional: Customize the list of forbidden patterns to detect. Defaults include .getSibling(), .getParent(), .getChild(), .parent, .children, and path traversal (../, ./)
BadComponentReferenceRule_config.case_sensitive: Optional: Set to false for case-insensitive pattern matching. Default: true
